context: Complete the sentences below in relation to sheep nutrition using words from the list.

parts.text: Steaming up
Gradual increase of concentrates prior to lambing is known as …………
Ewes being fed just enough to support body processes is known as ………..
Pregnancy toxaemia is also known as ……….
Calcium is added to the ration of the ewes prior to lambing to prevent ……….
Where would you rank the greenhouse gas emissions from agriculture in 2018?
List two sources of greenhouse gases from agriculture.
Briefly explain two ways in which they could increase biodiversity on their farm.
The use of 3D plans are likely to become more common in the future development of new infrastructure of farms.

subparts.text: Identify the structure located at B.
Describe one environmental hazard and one potential safety hazard of structure B. Environmental: Safety hazard:
Outline one way in which the farmyard layout is economically sustainable.
Explain how one named piece of new technology that you have studied could enhance economy of labour on this farm.

parts.text: The following is a plan view of a combined robot milking unit and cow housing for Claire and John who plan to convert their suckler farm to a dairy farm.

subparts.text: Explain why they have included an isolation area on the plan.
Describe the purpose of the footbath.
Outline one reason why Claire and John would have opted to install a robotic milking machine rather than a traditional herringbone or rotary parlour.
Place an X on the plan view above to show one place where you would advise Claire and John to install slatted tanks. Give a reason for your advice.

parts.text:
(i) Identify the estimated cost of liver fluke to Irish farmers annually.
(ii) Outline one environmental condition that allows liver fluke to thrive.
(iii) Suggest three ways in which farmers can control / prevent liver fluke on their farm.

parts.text: Name two dairy breeds that a farmer would choose to produce good quality milk for the dairy industry.
The dairy farmer wanted to carry out an investigation to test the hygienic quality of a milk sample over time.
